intro: Cylindrolobus longpasiaensis, commonly known as the longpasiaensis thistle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, showing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cylindrolobus longpasiaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
